an10.118:4.1: “Mendicants, I will teach you the near shore and the far shore.
an10.118:4.2: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
an10.118:5.1: “And what, mendicants, is the near shore? What is the far shore?
an10.118:5.2: Wrong view is the near shore, and right view is the far shore. …
an10.118:5.3: Wrong freedom is the near shore, and right freedom is the far shore.
an10.118:5.4: This is the near shore, and this is the far shore.”
an10.118:6.2: who cross to the far shore.
an10.118:7.1: When the teaching is well explained,
an10.118:7.3: are the ones who will cross over
an10.118:7.4: the realm of death so very hard to cross.
an10.118:8.2: an astute person should develop the bright.
an10.118:8.4: for the seclusion so hard to enjoy,
an10.118:9.1: you should try to find delight there,
an10.118:9.3: With no possessions, an astute person
an10.118:9.4: should cleanse themselves of mental corruptions.
an10.118:10.1: And those whose minds are rightly developed
an10.118:10.6: they are extinguished in this world.”
